enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Requisite:  Reserved for students who have taken & passed JOUR 301.
title: JOUR JOUR 311-0-21 Media Presentation: Magazine

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will help students develop the fundamental editing abilities, editorial judgment and editorial management skills required of an entry-level magazine editor in print, digital and mobile platforms. Story framing and pitching, editorial concept work, techniques for guiding writers, and opportunities to create new magazine prototypes are all central themes of the class. Students will gain insight into the magazine industry as well as the skills and options needed for the wide variety of career paths magazines offer.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
This course is reserved for pre-JR students.

Students who are assigned to take this course in a later quarter should NOT register themselves for this course.

Available seats may be released to CAESAR registration after pre-JR students have been enrolled, for those students who wish to take this course as an elective.

subject: JOUR
